dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1749 IH: Making the CFPB Accountable to Small Businesses Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Fitzgerald (for himself, Mr. Norman, Mr. Fallon, and Mrs. Miller of Illinois) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committees on Small Business, and Financial Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To impose additional requirements for covered agencies in regulatory flexibility analysis.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Making the CFPB Accountable to Small Businesses Act of 2023.

section.header: Rulemaking under Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
section.text: Section 1022(b)(2)(A) of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (12 U.S.C. 5512(b)(2)(A)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (i), by striking and at the end;
in clause (ii), by striking the semicolon at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: the impact of proposed rules on small entities, in accordance with section 609 of title 5, United States Code;

section.text: Section 603(d)(1) of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (C), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: where the covered agency does not adopt any alternatives described in paragraphs (1) through (4) of subsection (c), a detailed justification of the covered agency’s determination that the relative size and resources of small entities should have no bearing on the rule, supported by factual, policy and legal reasons.

section.text: Section 604(a) of title 5, United States Code, is amended in the second paragraph (6) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: for a covered agency, as defined in section 609(d)(2), a description of the steps the agency has taken to minimize any additional cost of credit for small entities and, where no significant alternatives for small entities was adopted, a detailed justification of the covered agency’s determination that the relative size and resources of small entities should have no bearing on the rule, supported by factual, policy and legal reasons.
